structural_unit_name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

description.en: This course examines the creation, legal nature and legal foundations of the EU; the fundamental rights and freedoms in the EU law; the general principles of EU law; the relationship between the national and EU law; the law-making procedures of the EU and member states' participation thereof; the implementation of the EU law in member states; the judicial system of the EU and actions and procedure in the Court of Justice of the EU. The course will deal to a large extent with the case law of the Court of Justice of the EU as the precedents have an essential role in the EU law-making.
description.et: Kursus käsitleb Euroopa Liidu loomist, õiguslikku iseloomu ning õiguslikku alust; EL-i õiguse põhiõigusi ja -vabadusi; EL-i õiguse üldpõhimõtteid; suhet riikliku ja EL-i õiguse vahel; seadusloome protseduure ja liikmesriikide osalust selles; EL-i õiguse rakendumist liikmesriikides, EL-i kohtusüsteemi ja EL-i Kohtu tegevusi ning protseduure.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to review the EU law as a dynamic process which co-exists and overlaps with national legal systems. It aims at expanding the knowledge in legal drafting and treaty-making, the legislative roles of the EU institutions, as well as the mechanism to settle legal disputes within the EU.
objectives.et: Kursus annab ülevaate EL-i õigusest kui dünaamilisest protsessist, mis eksisteerib koos ning kattub riiklike õigussüsteemidega. Kursuse eesmärgiks on laiendada teadmisi juriidilistest protsessidest EL-is, EL-i institutsioonide seadusandlikust rollist ning vaidlusküsimuste lahendamise mehhanismidest EL-is.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completing the course, the students will be able to:
1) become informed about the European legal integration, the constitutive elements of the EU acquis; and legislative roles of the EU institutions;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) teab Euroopa juriidilise integratsiooni arengut, ühenduse õigustiku (acquis) põhielemente ning EL-i institutsioonide seadusandlikke rolle;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) analyse the main sources and principles of EU law, their implementation in the practice and their relation to other general principles of law;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) oskab analüüsida EL-i õiguse peamisi allikaid ja põhimõtteid, nende praktikasse rakendumist ja suhestumist teiste õiguse üldpõhimõtetega;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) become informed about treaty-making and constitutional issues of the EU;
learning_outcomes.et: 3) on teadlik EL-i aluslepinguid ning konstitutsioonilisi küsimusi puudutavast;

learning_outcomes.en: 4) compare and contrast the relationship between the EU law and national law;
learning_outcomes.et: 4) oskab analüüsida EL-i ja riikliku õiguse suhet;

learning_outcomes.en: 5) understand and make distinction between different actions in the Court of Justice of the EU; choose the right remedy for a practical case; understand the procedural aspects and interpretation methods of the COJEU;
learning_outcomes.et: 5) mõistab ja oskab eristada erinevaid Euroopa Liidu Kohtu tegevusi; oskab valida õige liigi/tegevuse konkreetse kaasuse puhul; teab EL-i Kohtu protseduurilisi aspekte ning tõlgendamismeetodeid;

learning_outcomes.en: 6) analyse a judgment of the COJEU and solve a case in the framework of the basic course according to the given questions/methodology.
learning_outcomes.et: 6) oskab analüüsida EL-i Kohtu otsuseid ja lahendada etteantud kaasusi.

independent_work.et:
1.	Individual case analysis. Every student will be assigned a CJEU case for analysis. The case has to be analysed according to instructions and evaluation matrix. Max 20 points (20% of the final grade).

2.	Homework assignments. Students will be asked to complete an assignment in preparation of each of the 6 seminars (e.g., reaction paper, presentation on an area of EU law, completion of pre-readings or the like). Evaluation matrix provided. Max 20 points all together (20% of the final grade).

description.et: Individual case analysis (20% of the final grade). Every student is given a CJEU case for analysis. The analysis will be guided by instructions accessible via Moodle. Analysis is evaluated on scale of 20 points based on an evaluation matrix.

Homework assignments (20% of the final grade). Students will be asked to complete an assignment in preparation of each of the 6 seminars (e.g., reaction paper, presentation on an area of EU law, completion of pre-readings or the like). The assignments will be evaluated on the scale of 20 points all together based on an evaluation matrix.

Final exam (60% of the grade). The exam will be conducted with open sources and will be evaluated on the scale of 60 points. Further instructions and evaluation matrix for the exam will be available via Moodle.

grade_preconditions.et: Completing the case analysis and the homework assignments are prerequisites for taking the exam. Both have to be completed with a score of at least 10 points to have access to the exam.

grade_evaluation.et:
Individual case analysis (20% of the grade).
Homework assignments (20% of the grade).
Final exam (60% of the grade).

debt_elimination.et: Based on the study regulations and/or agreement with the instructor.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

structural_unit.address:
Lossi 36, ruum 301
51003 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.et: 1. Introduction. Aim of the course and materials. Basic treaties of the EU, treaty system, historical background
3. Courts of the EU and competences of the EU
5. Legislative procedures and direct effect of EU law.
6. Effect and nature of the EU law. Legal protection.
7. Participation of the EU in international relations and law-making. Common foreign and security policy.
8. Protection of fundamental rights in the EU.
9. Fundamental rights vs basic freedoms of the EU. Citizenship rights of the EU.
10. Actions against the EU and liability.
11. The single market. The free movement of goods and services.
12. The free movement of persons. The free movement of capital.
13. Concluding lecture - overview of the exam.
